Module Simulator
Package kin.invkin.jacobian

Class InverseKinematicsJacobian

java.lang.Object
kin.invkin.jacobian.InverseKinematicsJacobian
All Implemented Interfaces:
InverseKinematics
public class InverseKinematicsJacobian
extends java.lang.Object
implements InverseKinematics
Inverse kinematics computations based on the Jacobian matrix. This approach is useful for arbitrary manipulator configurations for which no closed solution exist.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    InverseKinematicsJacobian​(DirectModelKinematics directKinematics)
    Create an object that provides inverse kinematics computation on servo angles and linear motor lengths based on the Jacobian matrix.

    • getPositionJacobianMatrix

      public double[][] getPositionJacobianMatrix​(double[] state, int reference)
      Get the Jacobian for the gripper position. It has three rows and the number of columns is equal to DirectKinematics.jointSpace().length.
      Parameters:
      state - joint state variables
      reference - position reference, one of DirectKinematics.REFERENCE_WORLD, DirectKinematics.REFERENCE_BODYLOCAL
      Returns:
      Jacobian

    • motorSettingsForPos

      public MotorConfiguration motorSettingsForPos​(double[] targetPos, int reference)
      Description copied from interface: InverseKinematics
      Compute servo angles to reach a certain gripper position.
      Specified by:
      motorSettingsForPos in interface InverseKinematics
      Parameters:
      targetPos - the position to reach
      reference - the reference of the given vector, see DirectModelKinematics.REFERENCE_... constants
      Returns:
      the servo configuration to reach this position
